Deficiency Narrative: Documentation of Suicide Prevention policy is incomplete.
Correction Narrative:
On 06/09/25, the operation administrator submit the compliance plan. 

The Operations Policy was corrected to reflect the minimum standard and all required information in the agencies policy and procedures. Suicide policy has been uploaded to document library.

Deficiency Narrative: Child medication logs reviewed indicated the omission on specified time at which medication was given to the child. Signature on one record reviewed reflected no signature as to who dispensed the medication.
Correction Narrative:
On 06/09/25 Operation administrator submitted compliance plan.
Clear Vision noted that the children that receive twice per day medication, staff will omit am/pm on the medication logs. Administration added the AM/PM annotation that is pre-printed to the medication logs for meds given twice daily. 

Updated documents per compliance plan have been updated to Document Library.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication log on one of the records reviewed reflected no signature as to who dispensed the medication.
Correction Narrative: The medication log was corrected by the staff that did not annotate her signature. The designated staff (manager or lead) will be assigned to verify all signatures are documented on the medication records within 24 hours of administration.

Deficiency Narrative: During the review of drug screen of staff, it was observed that the drug screen did not include testing for PCP.
Correction Narrative:
On06/09/25, the operation administrator submitted the following compliance plan.

The operation requires staff will be drug tested through a lab (Concentra) during the onboarding process. In house drug tests for repeat screenings and random testing now are 12 panel tests and include marijuana, cocaine, opiates, amphetamines, and phencyclidine.  All staff that do not have the lab testing were tested in house with the 12 panel drug tests by a board-certified licensed family nurse practitioner. The operation includes the test results for all staff which has been uploaded to document library

Deficiency Narrative: During the review of serious incident reports, it was observed that the operation phone number was not included on the form.
Correction Narrative: On 06/09/25, operation administrator submitted compliance plan. The serious incident report was corrected and the phone number added to the paper document. Clear Vision uses electronic charting system as of 06/01/25 that has the facility demographics including, name address, and phone number pre-printed on the forms. A copy of the update serious incident report with the phone number has been uploaded into document library.

Deficiency Narrative:
Multiple seatbelts in the operation's vehicle are defective and unable to properly lock.  

Although the operation has another vehicle available to transport, on 3/28/2025 Licensing witnessed the vehicle with the defective seatbelts being used to transport youth.
Correction Narrative: The lead will conduct a pre-trip safety check to include making sure that the seatbelts are adequately working prior to loading the van with youth. In the event the seatbelts are not functional, the staff will utilize one or both vehicles that have working seatbelts to ensure all youth are transported safely. Seatbelts were repaired on 04/02/2025. All vehicles have operable working seatbelts. Seatbelts were repaired on 04/02/2025. All vehicles have operable working seatbelts.

Deficiency Narrative: Pre-employment contacts to employee's previous employers was observed to be missing from three of the four employee files reviewed.
Correction Narrative: Effective immediately, the LCCA will include the Pre-employment screening forms with the application and affidavit when an applicant interviews and is hired by the facility. The LCCA will file this screening form in the employee files behind the application.  The LCCA will check the employee binders on a monthly basis to ensure the pre-employment screening documents are being completed and filed.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee failed to maintain self-control when disciplining a child in care.
Correction Narrative: An employee failed to maintain self-control when disciplining a child in care.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver used excessive physical force by hitting a 9-year-old child with a shoe approximately three times.
Correction Narrative: A caregiver used excessive physical force by hitting a 9-year-old child with a shoe approximately three times.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was struck three times with a shoe as a form of punishment.
Correction Narrative: A child in care was struck three times with a shoe as a form of punishment.

Deficiency Narrative: A potential staff was present and involved in an incident prior to the operation receiving the eligible background results. The incident occurred at the operation on 4/10/24 but the BGC results were not received until 4/12/24.
Correction Narrative:
On 6/14/24 the following information was submitted via email from Krystal Williams, Administrator:
The LCCA will now complete all background checks before a potential applicant is allowed to be employed at Clear Vision Youth Center.  The LCCA has established a systematic approach to track and document the background check by using a spreadsheet with the applicant's name, date the background check was entered and the date of the results.  Once this information is completed then the applicant will be hired pending on the outcome of the background check.

A review of CLASS shows the background was completed on 4/12/24 for the staff involved in this report.
An in-person follow up was conducted on 06/24/2024, there were no current concerns with staff background checks.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care stated that an employee used profanity towards them as a form of discipline.
Correction Narrative:
It was stated during a follow up visit conducted with children in care that the alleged perpetrator no longer works at the facility, and no remaining staff use any profanity as a form of discipline.

The operation's Administrator emailed the following corrective action:
1.	Employee Atoya Eaden was taken off the schedule and ultimately terminated.
2.	Atoya Eaden was provided Non-Violent Crisis Intervention training and De-escalation techniques.
3.	Employees have been trained on the level system and we use a visible tracking board for the level system that employees use to take away stars as a form of discipline. Staff reward the youth based on the number of stars they have at the end of the week (allowance, extracurricular activities, and store trips to spend allowance).

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed in one of the four medication records reviewed that a daily medication administered on the morning of 11/20/2023 was not documented.
The health inspection is out of date for the operation which poses a safety concern for children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed a copy of their current Health Inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the four files reviewed did not include suicide screenings in Admission Documentation.
Correction Narrative: The admission assessments were updated to include an initial Suicide screening assessment via the Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale.  Suicide screening will be completed on admission and included in the admission assessment, monthly, and as needed depending on the residents presentation or at staff discretion.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four files reviewed was not observed to have a completed Initial Service Plan for a child admitted on 07/07/2023.
Correction Narrative: The service plan meeting is scheduled for 8/28/23.  To ensure that service planning guidelines are met and completed within 45 days the administration team will set tentative dates upon admission, and have the reminder posted on our tracking board to ensure adherance to the 45 day deadline

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four Service Plan's reviewed was observed to be missing a child's signature on a plan completed on 07/05/2023.
Correction Narrative: The resident has signed the service plan and upon the completion of the service plans the administrative team will ensure all service plan documents are signed within 48 hours.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication Record does not include a space for (c)(4) dosage or (c)(7) child's refusal.
Correction Narrative:
The Medication Record was corrected and now shows a space for the dosage and a childs refusal.

Updated job descriptions and policies were received and observed incompliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Evacuation diagram does not include outside meeting place.
